text:
Does anyone know why this doesn’t work? And how to get `"[i, h]"` from this?
```julia> keys = [:(i), :(h)]
2-element Array{Symbol,1}:
 :i
 :h

julia> s = string(keys)
"[:i, :h]"

julia> strip.(s, ':')
"[:i, :h]"```

elements.text: Does anyone know why this doesn’t work? And how to get

julia> keys = [:(i), :(h)]
2-element Array{Symbol,1}:
 :i
 :h

julia> s = string(keys)
"[:i, :h]"

julia> strip.(s, ':')

text:
Looking into it a bit more, it seems that strip isn't the function you want. I'll have to look into this more to find a different function. Let me see if I can find anything. (strip removes the characters that are at the beginning and end)

```julia> strip(":test:test:::", ':')
"test:test"```

elements.text: Looking into it a bit more, it seems that strip isn't the function you want. I'll have to look into this more to find a different function. Let me see if I can find anything. (strip removes the characters that are at the beginning and end)

text: Ah I see. I found replace.(keys, r”:” => “”) to work

text: Ah nice find! I'm glad that worked
